title: Anton Meier Ebsen Jørgensen – Profile / About me
description: Profile / About me: macroeconomics, econometrics, models, and communication. Working style, focus areas, and how I can help.

hero.title: Macro, econometrics and models — with a focus on making it useful
hero.lead: I work at the intersection of economics, data, and communication. I value "classic craftsmanship": clear assumptions, proper documentation, and results that can be explained without requiring the reader to have 300 pages of prior knowledge.

facts.text: Interests: Central banks, transmission mechanisms, heterogeneity

story.title: The Will to Disprove
story.text: My path to becoming an economist has not been straightforward. I have learned to turn skepticism into courage and adversity into resolve. Read my personal story about the journey from epilepsy and special education to cand.polit.

items.title: Macroeconomics & Monetary Policy
items.text: I am particularly interested in how monetary policy "lands" in practice: through financial markets, expectations, credit channels, and differences across countries/sectors.

items.title: Econometrics & Time Series
items.text: Forecasting, identification, and robustness. I enjoy methods that are both technically solid and can be explained to a regular person without them falling asleep.

items.title: Models & Structure
items.text: CGE/RBC/DSGE thinking: clear assumptions, consistency, checks, and baseline/zero-shock discipline.

items.title: Data & Tooling
items.text: I build small pipelines and templates: from data cleaning to output, ensuring reproducibility and reuse.

workingStyle.title: How I work
workingStyle.intro: My standard workflow (a bit boring — but that's exactly why it works):
steps: 1) Clarify goals: what should the decision-maker/reader be able to do afterwards?
2) Document data: sources, definitions, units, missing/outliers, transformations.
3) Choose method: simple first, then "fancier" if it adds real value.
4) Checks: sanity checks, robustness, alternative specifications, edge cases.
5) Communication: conclusions, limitations, and "what does this mean in practice?"

teaching.title: Teaching & Communication
teaching.intro: I have experience teaching Excel/VBA and like to keep things practical: cases, exercises, the "why" behind functions, and small shortcuts that make a big difference.

styles.title: My Teaching Style
points: Hands-on: better one good case than 30 slides

outside.title: Outside of studies
outside.text: I enjoy routines and progression — both in training and in projects. It might sound a bit "office-geeky," but it's honestly quite satisfying to see curves going in the right direction.

contact.text: If you want to discuss a project, a case, or a collaboration, please feel free to reach out.
